reviewText: Dean Martin was a great entertainer and his show was a real cultural phenomenon of its time. With that being said, I don't think this DVD does either of them justice. Oh, there's some funny material on this DVD but I would rather see an entire show or two rather than a few clips from here and a few from there.
summary: Far too short, far too editorialized
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found this for 45c in the fire bin at a thrift shop in a bad neighborhood. It's worth every penny! Dean wings it with the usual suspects. On parade is the increasingly arthritic Establishment of show biz, putting a few more bucks in their pocket. I can imagine hippies at the time rolling their eyes at this shtick. Their square parents loved every minute of it. "That Dom Deluise is a real card, Ethel." "Ho ho, that Jimmy Stewart floors me!" What's really great is Dean's Vegas-cool persona. What a smooth operator. What a player! He's dragging on a cigarette and ogling the chicks and not giving a damn. He can't wait until it's over so he can hit the golf links. He's so charming and easy-to-take that he gets away with every flub and look at the clock. Some performers suffer for their art, but not THAT cat. (What's funny, though, is how his hair rug went gray all of a sudden.) Dino was the sort of all-around entertainer who puts today's half-baked TV hosts like Jay Leno, David Letterman, and Conan O'Brien to shame. Dean had talent and ability, not just hype on a billboard. Kind of wish he were still around to show those losers how it's done.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you were a fan of the old Dean Martin Shows you will really enjoy these dvds. It takes you back to the times when television variety shows were at the height of their popularity and Dean was one of the kings of the variety shows. Some great guests and Dean knew how the handle them all.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A very enjoyable, very entertaining hour or so - sketches are very funny - one, with Frank Sinatra is hilarious.Garrison's narrative is very helpful, as he discusses Dino's genius at informal-formal art - what a great concept: Dino, in a tux, adlibs and reads cue-cards!Amazing sequence has Dean actually  playing director and stage manager and star as he has the chorus line basically start over, when one chorus girl flubs a line! "Take two" is better!The viewer under 40 might not understand what the celebration is all about and might not find some of the "70s Vegas Lounge" banter appealing, but the material is still strong.Recently, a Dean Martin greatest hits CD went to Number One on a Billboard chart. If those under 40 don't dig the jokes, it's almost guaranteed that the *music* will succeed!
summary: 5 stars if purchase price is below 20 bux
Title: N/A

reviewText: Instead of releasing the "Best of Dean" TV special that aired on NBC in 1979, producer Greg Garrison inexplicably re-edited and shortened the original broadcast for this DVD compilation. What remains are some classic moments from Dino's 1965-74 variety show, but little of the context that made the 100-minute retrospective so memorable. If Garrison intended to create an hour-long sampler, he should have started from scratch.
Title: N/A
